result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip A Scales in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Phillip A Scales in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files an amended information in 14CF1362 and 15CF861. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to Ct 1 in 14CF1362 and Cts 1, 4 & 5 in 15CF861, the state moves to DRI the balance of charges as well as 15CF1203. Parties are free to argue.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt.

BTC: guilty as above. SEH to be set out  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 10-02-2015 09:00 am.
Status conference at 10-13-2015 01:30 pm.

Defense requests bond modification. 
State objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is denied.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
